remarks: A number is less than or equal to the maximum of it and another.  This version of ~ max1 omits the ` B e. RR ` antecedent.  Although it doesn't exploit undefined behavior, it is still considered poor style, and the use of ~ max1 is preferred.  (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)  (Contributed by NM, 3-Apr-2005.)
statement: max1ALT $p |- ( A e. RR -> A <_ if ( A <_ B , B , A ) ) $.
